newsitem.title: USA: Cook County CFO says plans $75 mln GO refunding.
newsitem.headline: Cook County CFO says plans $75 mln GO refunding.

text.p: Cook County Chief Financial Officer Thomas Glaser said Friday he plans a refunding of $75 million of general obligation debt in a negotiated deal pricing August 12.
Glaser said the recent rally in the market made it possible to seek the refunding, the third in the past year for the county that includes the City of Chicago.
Cook County anticipates saving about $2.4 million with the refunding and will have saved more than $12 million through refundings in the past year, Glaser said.
Glaser said Cook County expects to return to the market in mid-1998 for the next phase of its capital improvement plan financing ongoing construction of the new County Hospital.

Cook County has issued about $125 million of bonds for estimated $552 million hospital. The next issuance could be for part or all of the remaining costs, depending on market conditions at that time, Glaser said.

BA Securities Inc will serve as the senior manager for the refunding deal in August, with Smith Barney Inc serving as a co-senior manager for the deal, Glaser said, adding that he hoped to sign off on the official statement Friday.
Cook County commissioners authorized refunding of up to $554 million of general obligation debt in March 1996. The latest refunding is set to close Aug. 27.

Chapman & Cutler has been designated bond counsel with Caldwell & Associates as co-bond counsel, Glaser said. Sonnenschein, Nath & Rosenthal will serve as underwriter counsel with Carney & Bros as co-counsel, he said.
